answer: A laptop is a portable computer with a built-in screen, keyboard, and touchpad. It combines a processor, memory, and storage into a single unit. It runs on batteries and can operate without being plugged in.

results.title: Laptop - Wikipedia
results.content: Laptops combine essentially the same input/output components and capabilities of a desktop computer into a single unit , including a display screen (usually 11–17 in or 280–430 mm in diagonal size), small speakers, a keyboard, and a pointing device (usually touchpads).

results.title: How Laptops Work - Computer | HowStuffWorks
results.content: How Laptops Work | HowStuffWorks How Laptops Work 1.   Laptop Processors 4.   Laptop Batteries Laptop Processors In addition, most laptop hard drives spin more slowly than desktop hard drives, reducing both heat and power consumption. Laptops frequently share memory between the CPU and the GPU, saving space and reducing power consumption. Laptop Batteries However, unlike a desktop computer, a laptop is portable and can run on batteries alone. Laptops combine all of the input and output capabilities and components of a desktop computer, including its display screen, keyboard, speakers, data storage, disc drives, and pointing devices (a touchpad or a trackpad), with a processor and operating system into a smaller device. Image 22: How Sound Cards WorkImage 23: laptop and smartphone Computer What Is a PC?

results.title: Computer Basics: Laptop Computers - GCFGlobal
results.content: A laptop is a personal computer that can be easily moved and used in a variety of locations. Most laptops are designed to have all of the functionality of a desktop computer, which means they can generally run the same software and open the same types of files. Because laptops are designed for portability, there are some important differences between them and desktop computers. A laptop has an all-in-one design, with a built-in monitor, keyboard, touchpad (which replaces the mouse), and speakers.

results.content: A laptop has all the same parts that a desktop pc has, some laptops dont have a seperate GPU/graphics card but have on integrated into the CPU.
